data.title: Green Planet Conservation Initiative
data.description: Green Planet Conservation Initiative is a non-governmental organization that promotes environmental conservation, sustainable practices and education through its green project initiative that is focused on agroforestry, reforestation, regenerative agriculture, and climate change awareness programs in Schools and local communities. We aim to create a more sustainable future for the next generation through our initiatives. We strive to leave a positive impact on the world and inspire future leaders to continue the mission of protecting the environment.
data.problem:
Climate change is a global phenomenon that has far-reaching effects on the environment. Northern Nigeria is no exception to this.
Northern Nigeria is a region facing Continuous deforestation because of the need for food, medicine, charcoal, and timber. The loss of tree cover, rainfall variability, increased temperature and events like wind erosion has had severe environmental consequences. In addition to tremendous loss of biodiversity, the region experiences soil degradation, erosion, desertification and landslides.
According to the United Nations, Nigeria has the highest rate of deforestation in the world, losing 3.7 percent of its forest every year. It is also home to Africa’s largest mangrove forest, but only six percent is protected. Its multiple ecological zones have given rise to a wide range of livelihoods, agricultural practices, and commodities, all of which are affected by climate change and shocks
data.solution:
Our Green Project initiative will help address the interconnected challenges of deforestation, climate change, environmental education, and biodiversity conservation, leading to a more sustainable future for our environment and communities. It will also raise awareness among school children and communities about the importance of environmental conservation and sustainability. By engaging students in tree planting activities, the project will help instill a sense of responsibility and empower them to protect their local environment. We are also partnering with federal college of forestry to preserve and conserve Pterocarpus erinaceus, commonly known as African Rosewood, a valuable and endangered species of tree native to Nigeria and Sahelian region of West Africa but due to over-exploitation and habitat loss, this species is at risk of extinction. More than 60 % of our planted trees since the end GG20 were more of this endangered specie. 
The Green Planet Conservation Initiative is also committed to ensuring the transparency, accuracy, and effectiveness of our tree planting activities. To achieve this, we are employing a digital Measurement, Reporting, and Verification (dMRV) Silvi protocol. These digital tools will enhance our ability to monitor tree growth, track progress, and provide verifiable data to our stakeholders.
data.missionSummary:
Our vision is to create a sustainable future for generations to come by promoting tree planting and environmental conservation in schools and local communities. We believe that by planting trees, we can help to mitigate the effects of climate change and create a more sustainable environment. We also believe that by raising awareness about environmental conservation through school campaigns, we can inspire young people to take action and make a positive impact on the world. The knowledge of planting and protecting the trees will be passed on to the next generations. 
Our goal is to plant 1 million trees in Northern Nigeria by 2030 through our school campaign program that is aimed to reach 100,000 students in the region. We hope to achieve this by partnering with local organizations, schools, and communities to promote tree planting and environmental conservation. We also provide educational resources and training to teachers and students to help them understand the importance of environmental conservation. Our specific focus is on empowering school children on tree planting
data.businessModel: The business model of the Green Planet Conservation Initiative is built on diversified funding sources, innovative approaches, and robust impact measurement. This model ensures that we can sustainably achieve our mission of environmental conservation, promote sustainable practices, and raise awareness about climate change.
data.stageIn: The Green Planet Conservation Initiative is currently in the Seed Stage. This stage is characterized by the development and validation of our core projects and business model, with a focus on securing initial funding, building a solid foundation, and demonstrating early traction and impact.
data.pathToTake: Want to grow through just grant funding

data.title: GG19 - Climate Solutions
data.description: We are participating in Gitcoin Round 19 (GG19).

data.name: Gitcoin
data.description: Gitcoin creates solutions that empower digitally native communities to fund, build, and protect what matters.

Summary
 Green Planet Conservation Initiative is a non-governmental organization that promotes environmental conservation, sustainable practices and Education. We achieve this, through our green initiatives such as agroforestry, reforestation, regenerative agriculture, renewable energy and climate change awareness creation. We aim to create a more sustainable future for the next generation through our initiatives. We strive to leave a positive impact on the world and inspire future leaders to continue the mission of protecting the environment

Grant Objectives
The grant funding will enable the Green Planet Conservation Initiative to significantly expand our environmental conservation efforts, promote sustainable practices, and increase climate change awareness and education. By achieving these objectives, we aim to create a positive and lasting impact on Nigeria's environment and communities, contributing to a more sustainable and resilient future. 

1. Expand Reforestation and Agroforestry Projects
•	Goal: To plant one million trees across Nigeria by 2030, focusing on schools, public spaces, and degraded lands.
•	Impact: Enhance biodiversity, combat desertification, and restore degraded ecosystems.
•	Activities:
-	Procurement and distribution of tree seedlings.
-	Site preparation and planting activities.
-	Post-planting care and monitoring to ensure high survival rates.

2. Promote Sustainable Agricultural Practices
•	Goal: To implement regenerative agriculture practices in rural communities, improving soil health and increasing food security.
•	Impact: Improve soil fertility, increase crop yields, and promote sustainable farming practices.
•	Activities:
-	Conducting workshops and training sessions for local farmers.
-	Providing resources and support for implementing sustainable agricultural techniques.
-	Monitoring and evaluating the impact of these practices on soil health and productivity.

3. Increase Climate Change Awareness and Education
•	Goal: To educate and engage over 50,000 students and community members on climate change issues, challenges, and solutions.
•	Impact: Foster a culture of environmental stewardship and empower individuals to take action against climate change.
•	Activities:
-	Implementing climate change awareness programs in schools.
-	Organizing community workshops and public awareness campaigns.
-	Developing and distributing educational materials on climate change 

4. Enhance Community Engagement and Participation
•	Goal: To involve local communities in all aspects of our projects, ensuring their active participation and ownership.
•	Impact: Strengthen community support for environmental initiatives and build local capacity for sustainable development.
•	Activities:
-	Engaging community leaders and stakeholders in project planning and implementation.
-  Organizing volunteer activities and community events to promote environmental conservation.
-	Providing training and resources to empower communities to maintain and expand conservation efforts.
data.title: GG20 - Climate Round

questions.query: How should the success of your grant be measured?
questions.explanation: Our impact can be measured by the level of community participation, feed back from Schools and communities, and the no of trees planted.

questions.query: What is the intended direct impact your project will have on the ecosystem?
questions.explanation:
Reforestation : With the support of generous donors, we've reforested degraded areas, creating green lungs that absorb carbon dioxide and release life-giving oxygen. These trees act as natural carbon sinks, mitigating the impact of climate change.

Biodiversity Boost: Our tree-planting efforts have not only sequestered carbon but also provided habitats for countless species. From songbirds to insects, these newly planted forests are bustling with life.

questions.query: What is the long-term impact of your grant?
questions.explanation: We hope to achieve a sustainable future for generations to come. We believe that by planting trees, we can help to mitigate the effects of climate change and create a more sustainable environment.

questions.query: How will the grant funds be used?
questions.explanation: Funds received will help us reach out to more schools and community and help us expand into other regenerative agriculture

questions.query: What is the timeframe for the work funded?
How will receiving a grant enable you to foster growth or innovation within the ecosystem?
questions.explanation: We are looking at expanding and going into other areas of agroforestry, reforestation and regenerative agriculture

data.description: Proposed visit to Lofy Grimshaw memorial institute for environmental awareness creation and tree planting exercise with students using dMRV to capture planted trees.
data.title: MILESTONE 5

data.reason:
We visited Lofty Grimshaw Memorial Institute as the fifth school in our line up of programs after GG20. We carried out  tree planting exercise with students and teachers of the school using dMRV Silvi protocol. We planted nine trees, taught them tree planting techniques, and allowed the students to take ownership and responsibility of the tree planting. There was awareness creation before the tree planting exercise. Our partnership with  Federal College of forestry, Jos also helped us discover Pterocarpus erinaceus, commonly known as African Rosewood, a valuable and endangered species of tree native to Nigeria and the Sahelian region of West Africa, but due to over-exploitation and habitat loss, this species is at risk of extinction. We are now incorporating this endangered species as part of the trees that we plant during our tree planting exercise. So far, we have planted a total of 46 trees using dMRV after GG20.


![Silvi protocol](https://x.com/GreenPlane49148/status/1818785997821464739/photo/3)

We had a successful awareness creation at Police Children School Bukuru where students were taught climate change issues and ways of mitigating it.
We also planted 9 trees, which were all captured on app.silvi.earth. a tree planting app that captures number of trees planted and the location.
We planted terminalia mentalis and Pterocarpus erinaceus, commonly known as African Rosewood, a valuable and endangered species of tree native to Nigeria and Sahelian region of West Africa, but due to over-exploitation and habitat loss, this species is at risk of extinction

data.title: MILESTONE 2

data.reason:
We had an awareness campaign on environmental conservation at Nufena private School Jos, where we educated the students on the impact of climate change and ways of mitigating it. We also taught the students tree planting skills, while allowing them to take ownership and responsibility for planting the trees. 

We Planted 25 trees at Nufena Private School. It was also captured on app.silvi.earth,  a tree planting app that captures planted trees with location.

Some of the trees planted were terminalia mentalis, Canarium schweinfurthii, however we planted more of Pterocarpus erinaceus, commonly known as African Rosewood, a valuable and endangered species of tree native to Nigeria and Sahelian region of West Africa, but due to over-exploitation and habitat loss, this species is at risk of extinction.

data.title: Milestone

data.text: The Green Planet Conservation Initiative seeks grant funding to support our mission of promoting environmental conservation, sustainable practices, renewable energy, and education through agroforestry, reforestation, regenerative agriculture, and climate change awareness programs. This funding will enable us to expand our efforts, reach more communities, and create lasting impacts on the environment and society.

data.name: $EARTH

data.title: GG21 - Climate Solutions Round
Tree Planting at Government Secondary sch.  Kuwiri
data.description:
Proposed Tree Planting Initiative atGovernment Secondary sch.  Kuwiri

Our planned activities aim to foster environmental awareness and sustainability among students. The initiative includes:

A hands-on tree planting exercise to promote active participation.
Educating students on the importance of tree planting in combating climate change.
Introducing the identification of various tree species to deepen ecological understanding.
Utilizing dMRV technology to document and monitor planted trees effectively.
Appointing tree ambassadors to nurture and oversee the growth of the trees, ensuring long-term success.
This initiative aligns with our commitment to cultivating a greener, more sustainable future.

data.reason:
Our team had the honor of visiting Government Secondary School, Kuwiri, for a transformative tree planting exercise. The event was an inspiring opportunity to equip students with hands-on training in effective tree planting techniques while educating them on the vital role trees play in mitigating climate change. Students eagerly participated in learning to identify diverse tree species, and our team employed dMRV technology to accurately document and monitor the planted trees. To ensure the sustainability of this initiative, we proudly appointed passionate tree ambassadors from the student body, nurturing a future generation of environmentally conscious leaders.

data.title: Tree Planting at Junuco school Jos
data.description: Proposed Tree Planting at Junuco school Jos, activities include: tree planting exercise, awareness creation on climate change, identification of different species of trees, capturing of planted trees using dMRV, nomination of tree ambassadors.

data.reason:
Our team had the privilege of visiting Junuco school, Jos, for an impactful tree planting exercise. During the event, we engaged the students in hands-on training on proper tree planting techniques and educated them on the critical role of trees in combating climate change. The students also learned to identify various tree species, while our team utilized dMRV technology to document the planted trees. To ensure long-term care and commitment, we proudly appointed enthusiastic tree ambassadors from among the students, fostering a generation of eco-conscious leaders.

Our team had the privilege of visiting Junuco school, Jos, for an impactful tree planting exercise. During the event, we engaged the students in hands-on training on proper tree planting techniques and educated them on the critical role of trees in combating climate change. The students also learned to identify various tree species, while our team utilized dMRV technology to document the planted trees. To ensure long-term care and commitment, we proudly appointed enthusiastic tree ambassadors from among the students, fostering a generation of eco-conscious leaders.

data.title: LAUNCH OF GREEN PROJECT INITIATIVE AT HWOLSHE
data.description: Planned to organize a significant event on September 24th, 2024, on climate change awareness and tree planting at Government Secondary School Hwolshe, Jos for Hwolshe community and schools around Hwolshe to be flagged of by the commissioner for education and the commissioner for science and technology, Plateau State. Targeting about one thousand participants in attendance. Key activities include lectures on climate change with key emphasis on prevention and mitigation, tree planting exercises, distribution of tree seedlings to participants, and nomination of tree ambassadors.

data.reason:
On September 24th, 2024, the Green Planet Conservation Initiative (GPCI) organized a significant event on climate change awareness and tree planting at  Government Secondary School Hwolshe, Jos. The flag-off ceremony was led by Prof. Obed Goselle, who delivered a powerful message on the importance of environmental conservation and the guest speaker Dr. Walter gave the key note address. The event saw the attendance of numerous dignitaries, educators, and community leaders, reflecting broad support for the initiative.

The Hwolshe community actively participated in the activities, which included an engaging awareness session and a hands-on tree planting exercise aimed at fostering climate resilience and sustainability. Trees planted were also captured using dRMV. This event marked another milestone in GPCI’s mission to combat climate change and inspire collective action towards a greener future.

data.name: Climate Coordination Network
data.description: Climate Coordination Network

data.title: GG21 - DeSci Round

questions.query: How does your project support the mission or goals of DeSci?
questions.explanation: The Green Planet Conservation Initiative (GPCI) supports the mission and goals of Decentralized Science (DeSci) by aligning its conservation and sustainability efforts with the core principles of transparency, inclusivity, collaboration, and innovation that DeSci promotes.

questions.query: Describe how funds from the grants program will be used for your project.
questions.explanation:
The funds from the grants program will be meticulously managed to ensure that every aspect of the Green Planet Conservation Initiative’s project is adequately supported. By focusing on reforestation, education, digital verification, partnerships, and operational efficiency, GPCI will maximize the impact of the grant, contributing to long-term environmental sustainability and community resilience.
The grant funds will be pivotal in ensuring the successful preservation and restoration of Pterocarpus erinaceus (African Rosewood) in Northern Nigeria.

data.title: CLIMATE EDUCATION AT GSS TUDUN WADA
data.description: Proposed Tree Planting Initiative Government Secondary sch.Tudun Wada. Our planned activities aim to foster environmental awareness and sustainability among students. The initiative includes: A hands-on tree planting exercise to promote active participation. Educating students on the importance of tree planting in combating climate change. Introducing the identification of various tree species to deepen ecological understanding. Utilizing dMRV technology to document and monitor planted trees effectively. Appointing tree ambassadors to nurture and oversee the growth of the trees, ensuring long-term success. This initiative aligns with our commitment to cultivating a greener, more sustainable future.

data.reason:
Our team had the honor of visiting Government Secondary School, Tudun Wada, Jos for a transformative climate education and tree planting exercise. The event was an inspiring opportunity to equip students with hands-on training in effective tree planting techniques while educating them on the vital role trees play in mitigating climate change. Students eagerly participated in learning to identify diverse tree species, and our team employed dMRV technology to accurately document and monitor the planted trees. To ensure the sustainability of this initiative, we proudly appointed passionate tree ambassadors from the student body, nurturing a future generation of environmentally conscious leaders.

data.title: LAUNCH OF GREEN PROJECT INITIATIVE AT HWOLSHE, JOS
data.description: Planned to organize a major community event on September 24th, 2024, on climate education, awareness creation and tree planting at Government Secondary School Hwolshe, Jos for Hwolshe community and schools around Hwolshe to be flagged off by the commissioner for education and the commissioner for science and technology, Plateau State. Targeting about one thousand participants in attendance. Key activities include climate education, tree planting exercise and ways of preserving endangered species, nomination of tree ambassadors, practical use of DMRV tool, distribution of tree seedlings.

data.text:
On September 24th, 2024, the Green Planet Conservation Initiative (GPCI) organized a Major communiy event on climate education and change awareness creation and tree planting exercise at Government Secondary School Hwolshe, Jos. The ceremony was flag-off by Prof. Obed Goselle, who delivered a powerful message on the importance of environmental conservation and the guest speaker Dr. Walter gave the key note address. The event saw the attendance of numerous dignitaries, educators, and community leaders, reflecting broad support for the initiative. The Hwolshe community actively participated in the activities, which included an engaging awareness session and a hands-on tree planting exercise aimed at fostering climate resilience and sustainability. Trees planted were also captured using dRMV. This event marked another milestone in GPCI’s mission to combat climate change and inspire collective action towards a greener future. 


![iclimate education](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GZDE9qEXsAA9bkE?format=jpg&name=large)
